channel.title: xmlhack
channel.description: Developer news from the XML community

image.title: xmlhack
image.description: News, opinions, tips and issues concerning XML development

item.title: CSS3 moves forward
item.description: The W3C released a new draft of Introduction to CSS, along with a new version of CSS3 Module: Multi-column Layout.

item.title: Publication day arrives for XML Media Types protocol
item.description: A document describing the handling of XML Media Types, first reported in xmlhack in a September 1999 story, has been officially released by the Internet Engineering Task Force as a new Request for Comments, RFC 3023.

item.title: Managing voluminous RDF description bases
item.description: Greg Karvounarakis has announced a paper describing RDFSuite, a set of tools for parsing, storng and querying RDF metadata.

item.title: Visual drag and drop SVG/DHTML editor
item.description: Steve White has announced an update to Virtual Mechanics' WEB ENGINE, a drag and drop editor for creating content in DHTML and SVG.

item.title: Apache Cocoon 1.8.1 released
item.description: Robin Green has announced Cocoon 1.8.1, which fixes a large number of outstanding bugs with Cocoon 1 and adds several new features.

item.title: SOAP::Lite v.45 improves interoperability
item.description: Paul Kulchenko has released version 0.45 of his popular Perl SOAP module, SOAP::Lite, improving Apache SOAP interoperability and adding new features.
